parameter_sets.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /* File parameter_sets.h begun on 20080606 by BLFoley
00002   Purpose: structures for adding parameters to ensembles
00003         and assemblies.
00004   NOTE!!!  This file is loaded with the molecules.h header file by default.
00005         It should only be loaded explicitly in a program if, for some reason,
00006         you are using it separately. */
00007 
00008 /* The parameter_set structure will eventually contain pointers for
00009 just about any type of data typically used in simulations.  As usual,
00010 there is also a void pointer for situations where information is needed
00011 that is not already included in the structure.  In any case, this is
00012 likely to be one whopping big structure, hence the separate file. */
00013 
00014 /************ sub structures for the parameter_set structure *****************/
00015 typedef struct{ // bond_type
00016         char **NT; // first and second atom types in bond (match NT in atype)
00017         char *desc; // description 
00018         double o; // bond order for this type
00019         double k; // force constant 
00020         double l; // equilibrium length
00021         double kx; // anharmonicity 
00022         double LJD_612,LJZ_612,LJD_1012,LJZ_1012; // Lennard-Jones params (D=depth Z=zero)
00023         double LJ6_612,LJ12_612,LJ10_1012,LJ12_1012; // Lennard-Jones params (alternate)
00024         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00025         void *VP; // the void pointers
00026 } bond_type; // bond types -- for describing bonds
00027 typedef struct { // angle_type
00028         char **NT; // the three atom types (match NT in atype)
00029         char *desc; // description 
00030         double k; // force constant (angular)
00031         double l; // equilibrium angle
00032         double kx; // anharmonicity 
00033         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00034         void *VP; // the void pointers
00035 } angle_type; // for describing angle parameters
00036 typedef struct { // torsion_type
00037         char **NT; // the four atom types (match NT in atype)
00038         char *desc; // description 
00039         int n; // number of terms in this dependence
00040         double *k; // force constant (angular) (n of these...)
00041         double *N; // periodicity (n of these...)
00042         double *P; // phase (n of these...)
00043         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00044         void *VP; // the void pointers 
00045 } torsion_type; // for describing torsion parameters
00046 typedef struct { // atype -- for atom types
00047         int n; // atomic number
00048         char *N; // element name
00049         char *NT; // name for element type
00050         double m; // mass of this atom type 
00051         char *desc; // brief free-form description field
00052         int nb; // number of typical bonds for this atom type
00053         double *bo; // typical bond orders (nb of these)
00054         int nlp; // number of typical lone pairs (to check geometry sanity)
00055         double LJD_612,LJZ_612,LJD_1012,LJZ_1012; // Lennard-Jones params (D=depth Z=zero)
00056         int nch; // number of charges to associate with this atom type
00057         int *ch; // the charges
00058         int nR; // number of radii 
00059         char **RD; // descriptions of the nR radii
00060         double *R; // radii (e.g., van der Waals, Poisson-Boltzmann, etc.)
00061         int nSC; 
00062         double *SC; // some other constant (e.g., screening) associated with R
00063 // Pointers for convenience
00064         int nBT; // number of bond types for this atom
00065         int *iBT; // pointers into a bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00066         bond_type **BT; // pointers into a bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00067         int nHBT; // number of H-bond types for this atom
00068         int *iHBT; // pointers into a H-bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00069         bond_type **HBT; // pointers into a H-bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00070         int nNBT; // number of non-bond types for this atom
00071         int *iNBT; // pointers into a non-bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00072         bond_type **NBT; // pointers into a non-bond_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00073         int nANT; // number of angle types for this atom
00074         int *iANT; // pointers into a angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00075         angle_type **ANT; // pointers into a angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00076         int nHANT; // number of H-bond angle types for this atom
00077         int *iHANT; // pointers into a H-bond angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00078         angle_type **HANT; // pointers into a H-bond angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00079         int nNANT; // number of non-bond angle_types for this atom
00080         int *iNANT; // pointers into a non-bond angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00081         angle_type **NANT; // pointers into a non-bond angle_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00082         int nTRT; // number of torsion types for this atom
00083         int *iTRT; // pointers into a torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00084         torsion_type **TRT; // pointers into a torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00085         int nHTRT; // number of H-bond torsion types for this atom
00086         int *iHTRT; // pointers into a H-bond_torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00087         torsion_type **HTRT; // pointers into a H-bond_torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00088         int nNTRT; // number of non-bond torsion_types for this atom
00089         int *iNTRT; // pointers into a non-bond torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00090         torsion_type **NTRT; // pointers into a non-bond torsion_type array where likely info is stored (to reduce search time) 
00091 // The void pointers for expansion
00092         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00093         void *VP; // the void pointers
00094 } atype; // atom types, with other info 
00095 typedef struct { // rtype -- for residue types
00096         int c; // main class (amino acid, glycan, solvent, etc.)
00097         int nac, *ac; // number alternate classes, those classes
00098         int nVP; // number of other information
00099         void *VP; // pointers to the nVP holders of other information
00100 } rtype; // residue types, with other info 
00101 typedef struct { // mtype -- for molecule types
00102         int c; // type class (amino acid, glycan, solvent, etc.)
00103         int nVP; // number of other information
00104         void *VP; // pointers to the no holders of other information
00105 } mtype; // molecule types, with other info 
00106 typedef struct { // types -- container for other type info
00107         int na; // # of atom types
00108         atype *a; // na of these
00109         int nr; // # of residue types
00110         rtype *r; // nr of these
00111         int nm; // # of molecule types
00112         mtype *m; // nm of these
00113         int nVP ; // number void pointers
00114         void *VP; // the void pointers
00115 } types; // superstructure for typing information
00116 
00117 /***************** structure parameter_set ********************/
00118 /* parameters for atoms, molecules, residues, etc. */
00119 typedef struct {
00120         int nAT; // number of atom types represented in this set
00121         atype *AT; // array of atom type structures
00122         int nRT; // number of residue types represented in this set
00123         rtype *RT; // array of residue type structures
00124         int nMT; // number of molecule types represented in this set
00125         mtype *MT; // array of molecule type structures
00126         int nBT;
00127         bond_type *BT;
00128         int nHBT; // for hydrogen bonds
00129         bond_type *HBT;
00130         int nNBT; // for non-bonded interactions
00131         bond_type *NBT;
00132         int nANT;
00133         angle_type *ANT;
00134         int nTRT;
00135         torsion_type *TRT;
00136 } parameter_set;
